org.apache.tephra.distributed

Class TransactionServiceThriftHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.tephra.distributed.TransactionServiceThriftHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TTransactionServer.Iface, RPCServiceHandler

    public class TransactionServiceThriftHandler
extends Object
implements TTransactionServer.Iface, RPCServiceHandler
    The implementation of a thrift service for tx service. All operations arrive over the wire as Thrift objects.

    Why all this conversion (wrap/unwrap), and not define all Operations themselves as Thrift objects?

    • All the non-thrift executors would have to use the Thrift objects
    • Thrift's object model is too restrictive: it has only limited inheritance and no overloading
    • Thrift objects are bare-bone, all they have are getters, setters, and basic object methods.
